metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18218 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In drivers/net/ethernet/hisilicon/hns/hns_enet.c in the Linux kernel before4.13, local users can cause a denial of service (use-after-free and BUG) orpossibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging differences in skbhandling between hns_nic_net_xmit_hw and hns_nic_net_xmit.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18218` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.10.0-33-generic - 4.10.0-33.37~16.04.1
linux-image-4.10.0-33-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-33.37~16.04.1
linux-image-4.10.0-33-lowlatency - 4.10.0-33.37~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-33-generic - 4.10.0-33.37~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-33.37~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
